config-lumon-enabled-tooltip: Master enable for LumOn screen-space global illumination.
config-probe-spacing-px-tooltip: Spacing between probes in pixels. Lower values = more probes = higher quality but lower performance. Recommended: 4 (high quality), 8 (balanced), 16 (performance). Requires restart.
config-anchor-jitter-enabled-tooltip: Enables deterministic per-frame jitter of probe anchor sample locations. Reduces structured aliasing and helps temporal accumulation converge to a cleaner result.
config-anchor-jitter-scale-tooltip: Jitter amount as a fraction of probe cell size. Maximum offset in pixels = ProbeSpacingPx × this value. Recommended range: 0.0 to 0.49.
config-use-probe-atlas-tooltip: Use a screen-probe atlas (directional probe cache with octahedral mapping) instead of Spherical Harmonics L1. Provides better temporal stability and per-direction hit distance tracking.
config-probe-atlas-gather-tooltip: Gather strategy when Probe Atlas is enabled. 'EvaluateProjectedSH' (Option B) uses an atlas→SH projection pass for cheaper gather. 'IntegrateAtlas' integrates directly from the atlas (higher cost, slightly more accurate).
config-hzb-coarse-mip-tooltip: Hierarchical depth buffer mip level used for early ray rejection in the tracer. 0 = full resolution, higher = coarser (faster culling but less accurate).
config-probe-atlas-texels-per-frame-tool: Number of probe-atlas texels to trace per probe per frame. With 64 texels total (8×8 octahedral map), 16 texels/frame = full coverage in 4 frames. Only used when Probe Atlas is enabled.
config-rays-per-probe-per-frame-tooltip: Number of rays traced per probe per frame (Spherical Harmonics mode only). More rays = faster convergence but higher cost per frame.
config-ray-steps-tooltip: Number of steps per ray during screen-space ray marching. More steps = longer rays can travel but higher cost.
config-ray-max-distance-tooltip: Maximum ray travel distance in world units (meters). Longer rays can capture more distant lighting but may introduce noise.
config-ray-thickness-tooltip: Thickness of ray for depth comparison in view-space units. Larger values allow rays to hit surfaces more easily but may cause light leaking.
config-temporal-alpha-tooltip: Temporal accumulation blend factor. Higher values = more stable but slower response to lighting changes. 0.2 = 20% history + 80% new data per frame.
config-depth-reject-threshold-tooltip: Depth difference threshold for history rejection in view-space units. History is rejected when depth changes exceed this threshold.
config-normal-reject-threshold-tooltip: Normal angle threshold for history rejection (dot product comparison). Values below this threshold reject temporal history. 0.8 = ~36 degree tolerance.
config-depth-discontinuity-threshold-too: Depth discontinuity threshold for edge detection between probes. Used to identify geometric edges for edge-aware filtering.
config-half-resolution-tooltip: Run gather pass at half resolution for better performance. Recommended for most systems. Requires restart to change.
config-denoise-enabled-tooltip: Enable edge-aware bilateral denoising during upsample pass. Reduces noise while preserving edges.
config-intensity-tooltip: Global intensity multiplier for indirect diffuse lighting output. Use to brighten or darken the overall GI effect.
config-sky-miss-weight-tooltip: Weight applied to sky/miss samples during ray tracing. Lower values = less sky influence on indirect lighting.
config-gather-depth-sigma-tooltip: Controls depth similarity falloff for edge-aware probe weighting during gather. Higher = more lenient depth matching (softer edges), Lower = stricter matching (sharper edges).
config-gather-normal-sigma-tooltip: Controls normal similarity power for edge-aware probe weighting during gather. Higher = stricter normal matching (sharper creases), Lower = more lenient matching.
config-upsample-depth-sigma-tooltip: Depth similarity sigma for bilateral upsampling filter. Controls how strictly depth differences affect the upsample weights.
config-upsample-normal-sigma-tooltip: Normal similarity power for bilateral upsampling filter. Controls how strictly normal differences affect the upsample weights.
config-upsample-spatial-sigma-tooltip: Spatial kernel sigma for optional spatial denoising pass. Controls the blur radius of the spatial filter.
config-upsample-hole-fill-enabled-toolti: Enables bounded hole filling during upsample for low-confidence indirect values. Uses the alpha channel from gather as a confidence metric.
config-upsample-hole-fill-radius-tooltip: Half-resolution neighborhood radius used for hole filling. Larger radius fills larger holes but may blur more.
config-upsample-hole-fill-min-confidence: Minimum confidence threshold required for neighbor samples to contribute to hole filling. Higher values = only use high-confidence neighbors.
config-use-combine-pass-tooltip: Use full combine pass for physically-accurate lighting integration. Provides proper albedo modulation, metallic rejection, and better control. When disabled, uses simpler additive blend (faster but less accurate).
config-enable-pbr-composite-tooltip: Enables physically-plausible indirect compositing with diffuse/specular split in the combine pass. When disabled, uses legacy diffuse-only modulation.
config-enable-ao-tooltip: Enables ambient occlusion application during indirect compositing. NOTE: AO is currently stubbed (no-op). gBuffer material alpha is reflectivity, not AO.
config-enable-short-range-ao-tooltip: Enables short-range AO visibility for indirect compositing. Currently falls back to surface normal (dedicated short-range AO source not yet wired).
config-diffuse-ao-strength-tooltip: Strength of ambient occlusion applied to indirect diffuse lighting. 0 = disabled, 1 = full AO occlusion.
config-specular-ao-strength-tooltip: Strength of ambient occlusion applied to indirect specular lighting. 0 = disabled, 1 = full AO (also attenuated by material roughness).
config-probe-atlas-leak-threshold-toolti: Light leak prevention threshold for probe-atlas gather. If probe hit distance exceeds pixel depth × (1 + threshold), contribution is reduced. Higher values = more tolerant (may allow leaking).
config-probe-atlas-sample-stride-tooltip: Sample stride for probe-atlas hemisphere integration. 1 = full quality (64 samples/probe, ~1.2ms), 2 = performance (16 samples/probe, ~0.5ms), 4 = ultra-fast (4 samples/probe).
config-texture-streaming-enabled-tooltip: Stages texture upload requests through Pixel Buffer Objects (persistent mapping when supported, otherwise triple-buffered PBOs).
config-texture-streaming-allow-direct-up: Allows direct (non-PBO) uploads when staging is unavailable or oversized. Disabling can avoid stalls but may defer uploads.
config-texture-streaming-force-disable-p: Forces use of the triple-buffered PBO fallback even if persistent mapping is supported. Useful for driver workarounds.
config-texture-streaming-use-coherent-ma: Uses coherent persistent mapping when available. Disabling uses explicit flushes; may be more compatible on some drivers.
config-texture-streaming-max-uploads-per: Maximum number of texture sub-region upload requests processed per frame.
config-texture-streaming-max-bytes-per-f: Maximum total bytes uploaded per frame (sum of processed requests).
config-texture-streaming-max-staging-byt: Maximum size (bytes) of an individual upload eligible for PBO staging. Larger uploads use direct upload if allowed.
config-texture-streaming-persistent-ring: Size (bytes) of the persistent-mapped ring buffer when supported.
config-texture-streaming-triple-buffer-b: Size (bytes) per PBO in the triple-buffered fallback backend.
config-texture-streaming-pbo-alignment-t: Alignment (bytes) for allocations inside the persistent ring.
config-material-atlas-async-enabled-tool: Build the material params + normal/height sidecar atlases progressively using a per-frame budget. Reduces loading hitches at the cost of longer total build time.
config-normal-depth-atlas-enabled-toolti: Enables baking and binding the normal/height (normal+depth) sidecar atlas during loading. Requires restart / re-entering the world to fully apply.
config-material-atlas-disk-cache-enabled: Caches material params and normal/height tiles on disk so subsequent sessions can skip expensive work.
config-material-atlas-progress-panel-too: Shows a small in-game overlay reporting material atlas build progress while async builds are running.
config-parallax-occlusion-enabled-toolti: Enables Parallax Occlusion Mapping in patched vanilla chunk shaders. Requires shader reload / re-entering the world to fully apply.
config-parallax-scale-tooltip: UV offset scale for POM in atlas UV units. Higher values increase depth effect but can cause artifacts.
config-parallax-max-steps-tooltip: Maximum ray-march steps for POM (used at grazing angles).
config-parallax-refinement-steps-tooltip: Binary refinement steps after the initial march.
config-parallax-fade-start-tooltip: Distance fade start in world units (camera-relative). POM effect fades out starting at this distance.
config-parallax-fade-end-tooltip: Distance fade end in world units (camera-relative). Beyond this distance POM is disabled.
config-parallax-max-texels-tooltip: Hard clamp for max UV offset in texels of the normal/height atlas. Prevents cross-tile bleeding and improves stability.
config-parallax-debug-mode-tooltip: Debug metric written to gBufferNormal.w. 0=Off, 1=UV rect edge distance, 2=Clamp hit, 3=Step count, 4=Fade/angle weight.
config-material-atlas-async-budget-ms-to: Per-frame time budget (milliseconds) for material params async jobs (CPU dispatch + tile uploads). Lower = less hitching, slower build.
config-material-atlas-async-max-uploads-: Maximum number of material params tile uploads (and overrides) executed per frame.
config-material-atlas-async-max-cpu-jobs: Material Atlas Async Max CPU Jobs/Frame
Maximum number of worker CPU jobs dispatched per frame for material atlas work.
config-normal-depth-atlas-async-max-uplo: Maximum number of normal/height jobs executed per frame (cached uploads, bakes, overrides).
config-normal-depth-atlas-async-budget-m: Per-frame time budget (milliseconds) for normal/height jobs on the render thread. Lower = less hitching, slower bake.
